lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We are recovering, some more than others, from Comic-Con. But we had a great time. Fantastic turnout. It was great to meet all those wonderful Critters that got out there, you guys were awesome. The panels were sufficiently ridiculous. And yeah, it was a good time had by all. If you weren't there, I know Geek and Sundry put up the panels, the videos from the panels up on the website, geekandsundry.com, so you can check them out there. Speaking of cool events, we're actually going to be at GenCon next week.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, it's crazy! I am at a series of panels all throughout the weekend, many of them voiceover-related.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because you're special.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're going to have signings I believe on Friday, or is it Friday or Saturday?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Saturday.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Saturday, we'll have signings--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In which we have a new poster.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is exclusive to GenCon, the same way we did our exclusive for New York Comic-Con poster last year.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also designed by Joma, aka @ForgingMeanings on Twitter. So yeah, it's our next iteration of our box art poster.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whoa! It is sexy!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The advanced edition, y'all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. I will say that the last poster was based heavily on the Underdark arc and the coming battle with K'Varn. This one has to do with a later arc in the story. So there's that coming up, we're excited about that, and then we have our Critical Role live show that Saturday at 8pm Eastern Time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's going to be some insane audience.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sam, if you want to say a few words.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Upload your local files to an encrypted cloud-based backup storage system, yeah. Backblaze back, all right! (speaking) That was good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was a thing that happened.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Backblaze is unlimited cloud backup for Macs, PCs, for just $5 a month. You can back up your fanart there, your fanfiction, the dirty stuff, photos, videos, drawings, documents, it's everything. I actually use this service. My stuff is continually uploading to the cloud and I always know it's there for when my hard drive crashes, they'll send you a new one in the mail--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They'll mail you one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They can mail you one. It's all kinds of crazy options.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Think of the gigs of erotica that could just exist out there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And they also made a little commercial for us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah, I just love them so much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know, it's so great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well cool, thank you very much, Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you want to hear the song again? (groaning)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we please? I'll give you some of my beef and broccoli.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It smells really good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next item: for anyone who wants any of the information about our GenCon panels events and signings and such, you can go to geekandsundry.com/CRLiveGenCon16.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's long. It should be in the chat room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Should be in the chat room, check it out, definitely go there. And tonight is the last night for you guys to pre-order the Critter-designed T-shirt, the Chroma Conclave shirt that you guys voted for that won our design contest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Twice. It won it twice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's beautiful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So if you're interested in grabbing that, tonight's your last night, and you should just do it now. Soon. Do we have anything else we wish to announce, anything else creeping up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Travis and I are seeing Hamilton this weekend. What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It is an announcement. We're seeing Hamilton on Saturday.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there any other shitty bragging anyone else would like to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's going to be awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have this all planned out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we really do. He's written some fanfiction about it. You just wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's there!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They've wandered through, met an old friend in Nala, the nymph of the lake. Discovered a fantastically artistically talented satyr by the name of Garmelie, and had a trip to the city of Syngorn, the elven city from Tal'Dorei which had phased into this realm for safety when the dragons of the Conclave attacked. After a fateful re-meeting with the parents of Vex and Vax, discussions were had, hats were attempted to be stolen by the leader of the city and successfully done so. The other half of agreements were pseudo-achieved.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Read your contract.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that was where we left off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Didn't you just get some card or something right at the end of--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I did.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did we know what it was?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I did.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was a free $50 coupon for Lyft.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What I'm really excited about is that card was at the live show, and it is not in my stuff right now, but I did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She reaches for the necklace around her neck, which is suddenly not there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! I do, however, still have my title.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You guys are still by yourselves, right? You two?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are Vex and I still separated?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the trees have relaxed, the canopy has reopened above the small clearing, and the rest of the party, you can now see Vex on her back on the ground, Trinket standing over her towards the cavern, and Keyleth pulled back, looking a bit shocked and confused.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And is Oralan still there? Is that his name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The bear spirit? The bear spirit, upon passing through Vex and Trinket, then dissipated into a spark of naturalized druidic magic and vanished.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we're alone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are now alone in the center of that clearing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my gods, what just happened? (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everything's under control. We're alive.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I heard growling. Did the bear try to kill you? I mean Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, yeah, Trinket tried to kill me, but don't worry, everything's fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really glad you learned how to speak with animals.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me too! Keyleth, can you open up the trees so our friends can get in?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who? Our what? Who?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aren't we blocked off?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The trees have laxed and reopened.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was busy looking for my card. And I found it. Hi guys, my name is Vex'ahlia. Cool, yes, we're good. Can I search for that tea set that I tried to give him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tea set? What just happened?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool. Balls. Off to a good start.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd like to take a look in the cave as well a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, yeah, it takes you a little bit, about ten minutes or so. Parts of it got scattered and lost amongst the rest of the objects left around, but you manage to reassemble your collection of tea accessories.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, cool, it was a golden cursed tea set.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nobody else is concerned about the commotion that happened behind the trees, and we're all just like "Hi." What happened?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There was a big fucking bear. You might actually not want to look in that cave, because it came out of there and it was rather angry when it did.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What it? What came out?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A guardian spirit of the forest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just observing the entrance to see if there's anything written, any type of language on any of the entrances or otherwise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As a druid would I know about guardian animal spirits?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, would we have heard anything about this in our studies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In your studies? No. You, make a history check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not my strong suit, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll go with nature.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh that's better, okay. 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are no markings that currently are visible around the entrance or exit of the cavern itself. It is carved, however, meaning that this cavern, whether it be natural or not, this entrance has been touched by humanoid hands and has been refined. You, Keyleth, do know that occasionally on the Material Plane there are entities, spiritual energies, that gather based on worshipping specific fey spirits and these creatures over time, these spiritual energies, begin to take the form that their worshipers give them. It takes a long time for this transition to happen, and essentially these guardian spirits, usually guarding some sort of a powerful fane, or a magical core or center, they become protector spirits of that region.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So because people just manifested the god as a bear, it slowly turned into a bear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It turned into a bear. And they're not gods per se, but they're powerful entities that guard that element.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Spirit guardians. Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's in the cave?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's in the cave, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nothing now, I don't think.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There was a spirit bear in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was a bear?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a big fucking bear, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was made out of stars and space stuff.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you sure you haven't been eating mushrooms or something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's exactly what I was thinking.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I go over to Trinket and I surreptitiously start feeding him biscuits-- you don't know-- biscuits that I took from my father's house. Good boy, that's a good boy. Good job.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're gone in a matter of moments. Licks the side of your face, leaving some saliva and crumbs.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will always give you that shit. Don't forget.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy, did you find anything in the cave?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing of consequence.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far in did you go?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, that looks dark and there was a giant cosmic bear in there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Would I know if after the spirit guardian has passed, would he just go back in his cave?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've never really encountered one before, you've only heard about them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about Garmelie. Would he know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're welcome to ask him if you want to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, Garmelie. What do you know about this fucking bear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's in the very back, just watching you guys. "I know what you know. It's apparently here "and people leave him little presents, and seemed pretty scary from the way you describe him, so--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you know he was going to be here at this cave?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, I would have avoided this!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Somebody insight check that little bastard.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'll insight check that little bastard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll insight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would do it, but eh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's hard to read in general because he's such a strange individual, but yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like he would've told us to avoid it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And bears are fairly territorial. I don't know, it might be wise to stay out of the cave.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think in general it's probably best to respect anything's home on this plane of existence.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Boring. Scanlan, you want to go in?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're not here to go spelunking. Why are we going to go in this cave?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god, we're in the Feywild, we're about to pull a bow out of a tree, and you don't want to see what's in the creepy cave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should save our strength for the fucking bow in the tree.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus, do you know there's a theater here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We're not going to the theater."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I understand, but just so we don't accidentally go there, where is it in relation to this tree? Is it on the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shift. Change location."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a touring production.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't trust anyone who doesn't like the theater. What exactly is your issue with it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't worry about it. Anyway. Shall we?" And he begins marching back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I really don't think we should mess with this thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look, Grog, I touched a flower and the whole realm almost collapsed, okay? I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know, I'm looking at the scandalous one over there that's always trying to get little goodies for himself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What can I tell you? I normally like to gamble and I'm not feeling a gamble on this one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, you went (boop). I'm just saying.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's just not pretty enough. It's really not pretty enough. We've already won something here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, fine. I'm happy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You say "stay," we stay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if we run, touch the back of the cave, run back. We don't even have to pick up anything. Just to say we did it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Last time I touched something, I didn't hear the end of it. And now we're just going to let this happen?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, yes, because we don't care if they die.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What, all the bad shit already came out of it, what do you say?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: By that logic, mathematically there's no more bad shit in there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there anybody here of reasonable intelligence who wants to stop this from happening? Just checking.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think that we should do anything. It does seem like a bit of a double standard that everybody threw poo at Keyleth for picking a flower.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (deadpan) Please, whatever you do, don't do it, my god please.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know, he's got the raised eyebrows. I'm not sure if we should do it or not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm just enjoying the conversation. Make your choices.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You do you, man. You do you, guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you're going to do it, have a light source.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What, ten or higher we go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten or higher we go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughing) We're so going.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I put Scanlan on my back, and we run straight into the cave.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hand a torch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't want any torch. I've got darkvision!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The floor of this room is entirely covered in unlit candles, except for in the center there is a raised stone platform that contains a singular skull made of some sort of a bluish or aquamarine crystal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's not what I was expecting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jackpot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jackpot?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are the greatest ones in the group. Are the candles standing up or are they laying over?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're standing up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can't take the skull.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a large skull, it's like this big, and its elongated snout--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it's an animal skull.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a beast-like skull.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it a bear skull?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have not said anything to the rest of the group.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I thought they were saying this out loud.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I discern what kind of animal skull it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I do one, as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Yeah, you would. Yeah, as a traveling herd member, you would know cleaning creatures and stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea what creature this is. It does look bestial in nature.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you dead yet?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Still alive. Everything's okay. It's all gold and silver.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, there's nothing that moves in here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, Percy, do you have an hourglass thing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, but I can keep very good count, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We should play that gambling game.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I bet-- how much gold do I have?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much gold do you have?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Three gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We keep taking it from her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true. That we have to run in after and save them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't want to take that bet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're going to take that bet?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take that bet. I'll take a three-gold bet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. That they come out safe and sound?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 200 seconds.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 200 seconds. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Meanwhile, inside the cave, the two of you now stand at the edge of this room filled with small, wax structures and wicks that are currently cold in the darkness, and the central platform holding the crystalline skull in the center.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In that circular area, is there anything on the back wall? More candle sconces?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't make out any details. It looks like somewhat rough cavern walls, but not very smoothly carved or anything.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And the skull is big, like the size of my chest?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's probably a little bit smaller than that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Made of gems or stone or bone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks almost like it was carved and hollowed from a singular giant solid piece of opal or aquamarine. Like it's a gemmed skull in the sense that it's made from gem material.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does it look like it could have been a bear skull?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know, mister nature-roll-of-12.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Listen, Grog. I don't think it's very valuable.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, but look at it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's pretty amazing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're in a secret chamber.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is cool. But what would we do with it? We can't trade it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I bet they worshiped it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I bet something still worships it. And that thing could come back and be mad if we take it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there a crapload of footprints on the ground around us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell. You've arrived, both paced in your space there, so there are plenty of footprints that you guys have left. It's hard to see if there are any more recent ones are from other creatures.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Want to take a candle as a souvenir?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wouldn't mind getting a closer look at that skull.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Well, let's do that, then.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 100 seconds have gone by.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can't walk over there without disturbing candles, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably not, unless you're ballet-style en pointe.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can throw you. Taking it back to the old school. That's a little careless.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can grab it. I do have a big hand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's like getting your hand on it right away. It's pushing the button.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do we do? Do we just leave and come up with a good story?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Here, how about this: let me cut your face.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When we run out, you'll be bleeding and crying, and it'll be horrible. And we'll just make something up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. (laughing) Perfect. Are you ready to go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, where are you going to cut me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Right above the eyebrow so there's lots of blood, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, right in the middle, like the Bruce Willis cut. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ah, Sir Bruce Willis of Emon. Dangerous life he led in history.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But not too deep, right? I want to be able to still make the ladies swoon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, cool. I'll take out my-- not Mythcarver.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why not? You were going to cut me with a Vestige?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're going to roll a 20 and decapitate him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I take out my other longsword. My Aberration Bane longsword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing) Are you an aberration?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll slice him right over one of the eyebrows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You take one point of damage, and the goliath blood doth flow aplenty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (grunting) Are you ready? Let's sell this shit. And I put him on my back and we take off running! (yelling) Oh, it's horrible!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (yelling) There are bears everywhere! Bears! Little bears, big bears!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We burst out into the sunlight, and I intentionally trip and eat shit. Scanlan goes flying, boom!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There was a bear right on Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god! It was so vicious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was horrible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You didn't fight them at all?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, there were bodies everywhere! Children! Women! They were stapled to the ceiling! And then there were just horrible--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So did the bear only have one claw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This guy wants to go to the theater.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll have the rest of you roll an insight check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is the lucky one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh man, that sounds scary.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I was in the mouth of a bear, and Grog cut the thing from asshole to lips to get me out of there. It was crazy!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's disgusting. So there was really nothing there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think that means you owe me three gold, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighing) Oh, bloody hell.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you bet to see whether we would live or die?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, not at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did you really find in there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Some candles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And a big skull.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We reached out to touch it and it cut my face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That sounds terrible. I wish Pike was here; she would really enjoy this story.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was a worthless endeavor. We're sorry we went.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, how about that Chroma Conclave, eh?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, so the candles and skulls were there, or they weren't there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, there were a ton of candles and a skull.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seems like a place of worship or devotion, and we didn't want to mess with it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well a lot of these spirit guardians tend to have worshipers, and a lot of times they'll bring them gifts, so that makes sense. Yeah, I probably should have told you guys that before you went in, sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's only one show in a day; we don't want to miss it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like how all of us sound like we've lost our voice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it sounds like we've all been through hell. Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, since I touched the skull and I cut myself, could you do me a little. (clicks tongue)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You want me to lick it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, don't you have a thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like healing? Like you want me to use a whole spell on this teensy-ass wuss cut?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you care about me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Cure Wounds on his little teeny-weeny cut.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that feels so much better.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vex, what do you think, is a semi-precious gemstone skull worth going in and getting?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we should remember this place is-- well, it's probably going to disappear after we walk away. These things tend to move, don't they?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We should move toward our destination.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to focus on the bow. And it's really hard to say that, but I really--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The whole theory of a path is you're supposed to somewhat stay on it, I imagine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So stay on it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No more stops. Unless it's for the theater, we're not stopping again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you can tell, it looks like it's in the evening, with the moon up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we've been awake for a while?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Full journey here since you rested... make an intelligence check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural 20, except disadvantage because I'm exhausted. 16 plus two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. After resting just outside of the Moonbrush, it's probably been three hours since you woke.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, we rested?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you guys push on when you got there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was wondering the same thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought we camped on the outskirts.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whatever we decide right now is exactly what happened.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, so we camped and we got up, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. What? Yes, of course.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I agree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I feel like there would have camping before going straight into the Moonbrush, and I think you may have been pressed for time at the event last time to try and do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All I know is my mansion spell has been ticked off. So I used it at least once in the last 47 hours.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I feel like we camped out right before we went into the Moonbrush.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We camped out right before that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, so it's been a few hours since you regained consciousness. It wouldn't have made a huge difference, per se, but you were still reading the book. You're close now, at this point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'm close.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A handful of hours away from completing it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I can take off this negative seven hit points that I don't even remember how I got, probably.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, that you would have gotten from the large bear, so no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice try. All right, so as you guys gather here, Garmelie goes, "All right, so duskward is-- "that way. Who's leading?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I'm not leading. I'm guiding you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You guide. In the front.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm guiding you duskward. I've never been inside the Moonbrush! I know of things around it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How were you planning to guide us through it if you don't even know how to do it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was always the plan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm getting you to your destination by helping guide you there."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But if you can't guide us through the Moonbrush--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am guiding you through the Moonbrush, I just think somebody should take the lead."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But you said you've never been here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He wants something big in the front.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm just wondering what his use will be from here on out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How about you and I, we can be in the front.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's Duchess of the Grape Hunt so she's very good to lead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Great, wondrous. That'll work fine."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Duchess of the Grape Hunt, what a wonderful title.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on a second, Garmelie. Huddle real quick. Why don't we send him home? He could die.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm all right with that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's not going to be any use from here on out. He's never been here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He knows things about the Feywild that we don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The only thing I worry about is we made a deal with him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's under contract, which means that there are places and things he might be able to help us with.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He shook our hand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it couldn't hurt.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's worth having him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also, if it turns out he's not who he says he is--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which I'm starting to get a very strong feeling of.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll find out who he really is later.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's a bit of a sneak, too. The only reason we have him is because you spotted him because you're awesome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And he wanted a hat, how bad could he honestly be?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right? It looks very good on him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Present company included, of course.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We got betrayed by Clarota at the 11th hour, so--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're so much cooler now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's just put Vex and Vax.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hold my hand, dear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right." He takes your hand. Roll a survival check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He eats her hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17, okay. Holding your hand, you guys quietly begin to make your way through the Moonbrush.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Eyes out for any things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're in your natural element, also. It's a forest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, can I ride on you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Girl, you can always ride.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I just need to be reading.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Much like a kid in the backseat of a car on a cell phone, Scanlan is just reading through the book on the back of Grog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Station wagon. Facing backwards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can always ride on Trinket, too, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. Grog weirdly smells better than Trinket today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About another two hours of travel duskward, and he's keeping a finger pointed in the direction, which is difficult for you because the moon placement in the sky has not changed. The correlation as to what you normally use in the Prime Material Plane to gauge direction has no use here whatsoever. So the best that you can do is try to keep yourself facing forward and using his occasional guidance to steer back on track.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to try to learn from him how he's gauging his surroundings and stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's nothing more to it than that. He'll take a moment to think and look around, lick his finger, point in a direction.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a nature check to see if I feel a breeze at all, or is he bullshitting?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they way ahead of us or are they just up ahead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no breeze. There is no sound in the forest here. There is no sound of leaves clattering. He's just doing that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because it makes him seem smart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does the licking do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Licking is how I initiate the specialization of my arcane understanding of the "flow and ebb of the fey--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're bullshitting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No! This is a technique. And it's leading us to your destination. Have a little faith. You "hired me for a reason."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So much faith in you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is he taking us to the theater right now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Definitely the theater.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not the theater!" Pressing on, I want you to make another survival check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20. And I don't even need to roll again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As we go, I just want to Druidcraft little green pebbles. No, let's do brighter-- red pebbles to start leaving behind Hansel and Gretel style.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Lead something right to us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Little pebbles. Tiny pebbles that I can recognize.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you're creating small stones that trail behind you as you go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Every hundred feet or so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys progress forward, you start finding patches where the ground itself gets a little mushier, like either there's a nearby river or the ground itself has retained liquid more than other areas of the forest. You begin to see the faint appearance of familiar green sprouts that come through. These are mandrakes, and you manage to catch them before the rest of the party gets there, you and Garmelie, especially with your sight and knowledge of this area, you manage to guide the party around that whole field of waiting mandrake.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do they do? Do they just scream a lot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Progressing forward into the next section, I need you to make another survival check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no. 12. Oh, double-double! That's better! 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25! Shit, girl. Eventually, you come to what appears to be a river that's cutting through this portion of the Moonbrush. Just on the other side of that river, you hear a faint sound of music.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The theater!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) What is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What is what? I don't--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The music, do you hear it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hold on, are you saying you don't hear anything right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, right now nobody hears it except for you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does it sound like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It sounds like a soft violin, with a hint of flute, and a drum beat. It's very simple. It's very basic.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it sound pleasant?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does sound pleasant. It sounds folksy and whimsical. It's very, very faint.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There must be people further in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You hear music?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Could be dangerous.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I listen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Garmelie's like, "We really don't need to go in that direction."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know anything about music playing randomly in the woods?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Music can be good, it can be bad. Who knows? Dangerous music is very often a thing in "places you don't understand. I would not recommend wandering into places of phantom music."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should check it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I want to hear some music.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What direction is it coming from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take a few steps. There is still a river, which is about 15 feet across. It's a soggy bank that leads into a lazily running river. So you have to cross that first. It looks to be a little ways duskward and to your right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have to cross the river.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't need to stick a stick into every beehive we come across.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But this is the theater.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it the theater?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't know actually know. It could be anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It could also be a camp.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It could be many things.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I recognize the music?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't, actually. It's not a classic ditty. The structures are familiar. You can see where the basis of a lot of bar shanties come from; a similar bouncing beat to it, but nothing that catches you as really familiar.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispered) Ugh. I want to see what it is that's doing it, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, but we got to cross this river to get to it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to do it regardless, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How big is the river?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 feet across.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a stream. It's nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He said it's lazy, right? It's just going along, but I call bullshit 'cause we're in the Feywild.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're very clever about that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You said we have to get across, regardless, Garmelie?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, yes, if we're heading toward your destination, we have to cross."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have to get across the river, regardless?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you make us a bridge, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can control water and part the river for a second.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that's even better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For a hot second?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For a hot second, yeah, I was trying to stop myself. I cast Control Water and make us a little bubble as we walk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you watch as the stream begins to separate--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't want to Moses this, I want to give us a little bubble that we stealthily walk under the river with the little bubble.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys find your way, walking down onto the bank of the river, your boots sinking into the very soft, soggy bottom of the river. You walk across, make your way to the other side. The river splashes as the bubble is no longer required. You traverse it; no issue. It's a river. The music is a little louder on this side of the bank and is off to the right side.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we send Vax ahead?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, let's go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Garmelie? Do you want to come with us? Go invisible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Um. Okay?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will hold your hand, don't worry dear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right." So he vanishes from sight. The two of you guys make your stealth checks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, can I cast Pass Without a Trace on us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so adding plus ten to your stealth rolls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa. 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The rest of you are staying behind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sounds like jovial laughter, like people having a good time. Just a few voices. You hear two different voices going back and forth, laughing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Our mother read us stories about shit like this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did she?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, she did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't remember.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fairies. Grumpkins. I don't know. It's probably going to end badly. Do you want to go have a look?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just wanted to see, but if you're worried about it, we don't have to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oi! You lot! I just had a thought.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why start now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If there's music, there could be some sort of charm effect.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Would you like me to come with and maybe counter that charm effect?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The bard is just now figuring this out?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get on up here, you stealthy fuck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I put down my book and hop off of Grog and go up there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I sit down with Percy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Add ten to it because of Pass Without a Trace.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think you cast it on me, did you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast it on everybody that's within 30 feet of me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I there yet? I'm exhausted.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's at disadvantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Same. What is it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stealth. Plus ten.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Hey, that's 18! That's not bad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would have been eight?! Jesus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I sit down with Percy and I say: six gold that after 200 seconds, they run out screaming again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I be doing Countercharm? Can I hum a little tune? Is that how it works? I don't know how it works!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's time for you to learn how one of your abilities works here, Sam. For countercharm: as an action, you set up a performance that lasts until the end of your next turn. During that time, you and any friendly creature--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It lasts six seconds?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hold on. You can keep doing it every round if you want to. It doesn't say there's a limit to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I'll keep humming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has to be loud enough for them to hear you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. I'll hum loudly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to break our stealth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to happen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, one way or the other. You've got countercharm or keeping stealthed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, fuck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll stealth, and if it starts to feel icky, then I'll do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I basically just want to see what the fuck is laughing. I want to see what it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I do not see a mummer's show from this, there will be hell to pay. Now let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the three of you and Garmelie, who's invisible at this point in time, you approach what looks to be a clearing ahead of you now. The trees actually disperse a bit. You can see what appears to be a small campfire that's crackling in the center of this clearing. And the music is actually quite loud now. You see figures jaunting around this fire and holding hands and swirling for a second and then separating. Then dancing a little ways around it again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What kind of figures?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have to get closer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck! Fuck this. Fuck it. I'm not doing it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will go closer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. Don't fucking go closer. I get a really bad feeling. All of a sudden, I get a really bad feeling about this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 39 stealth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm behind a tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're behind a tree. Garmelie is staying with you. What are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I sing to him through the earring? No, we talked about that before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the effect has to be within hearing, so either you go up with him or you stay behind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to stay behind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So Vax, you come up to the very edge of the clearing. You vanish. You come to the very edge of the clearing. You see before you where the laughter's coming from. There is an elf, in full Verdant Guard armor of Syngorn, who is skipping and laughing around the fire, dancing alongside what appears to be a bipedal humanoid creature covered in fur with claws, a longer snout. And they are both smiling and holding each other's hands and spinning and twirling each other. And dancing around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're totally charmed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the music is actually coming from a floating spectral violin, flute and drum, unmanned by any creature; just slowly drifting around the clearing, around the entities that are dancing. I also need you to make a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah, there it is!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, jeez! Is it a charm effect?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, is it? Because I have advantage if it's a charm effect.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I'll use one Luck for the day. First Luck. All right. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. Okay. Looking forward, you find a tapping on the side of your hip as the beat finds you. And you begin to drift out of the shadows into the center of this clearing. You look over and see as the guard extends his hand and takes yours. The beat kicks into you, a smile creeps across your face--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take my broom out and I start flying up and I grab Scanlan's hand and take him on the broom with me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where we going?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to fucking get Vax out of there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I start singing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Countercharm. (jazzy saxophone riff)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gentle sounds of Careless Whisper keeping any possible invasion of your mind at bay, hopefully. You just hear Garmelie behind you going "No! What are you doing?!" echoing through the trees as you guys dart in towards the center of this camp. You--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm on, man. I'm lit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are totally on. This is an amazing experience. You feel the color and the music surging through you, and all through this endless surge of energy inside as you begin to now join into this other dancing trio.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fucking werewolf guy look good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You guys dart into the center of this, hearing the music, hearing the laughter, watching your brother with a Joker-like smile on his face, the sheer joy pulling his expression into one of a very disturbing joy. I need both of you guys to make wisdom saving throws with advantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh dear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Advantage versus magic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I already had advantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, there you go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23? All right. You sweep in at this point, and find that Scanlan jumps off the broom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! Don't jump off the broom!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Acrobatics.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Save? Check? Ten. Check or save?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You catch yourself. It wasn't a large fall. You land on your feet down on the ground with a crunch. A number of things crunch and break beneath your feet as you stand up and you look up and see as Vax, this elvish warrior knight, and a straight-up wolfman all lead you into the dance, and the four of you now begin to take each other's hands and laugh and skip around in a circle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to try to Pokéball Vax into my necklace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to try to do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm hearing this cacophony, and I'm slowly getting up with a sigh and moving in the direction of the campsite.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You might have won this bet this time, Percy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not yet!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Slow walk. You've got time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm holding onto my six gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have to make a wisdom saving throw against me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why'd you roll twice?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because I have advantage against charm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's not charm! It was just wisdom.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, then I rolled shit. It's just a five.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then he goes in the Pokéball!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are pulled into the necklace. I'm really going to push to refer to it as a necklace.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry, necklace. The Raven's Slumber necklace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to really push to have it be called a necklace. Vax, all of a sudden you're pulled out of this dance, and your head is clouded for a second as you find yourself in a singular darkened stone room. Four walls, a single stone throne in the center of it facing out towards a glass window the size of the other walls. It shows an image of the perspective of the necklace.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: First conscious person to go in here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Second, technically.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Second to Grog.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog was unconscious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I wasn't.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He was very close to death.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I grab Scanlan?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm doing the Russian Bottle Dance from Fiddler on the Roof right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fantastic.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to fly down and get him around the waist and pull him out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an athletics check. I need you to make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, so roll and add your acrobatics with disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Athletics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. You manage to grab Scanlan, pull him onto the broom with you. The two other dancers immediately reach up and grab him and try to pull him back down into it. At this point, you look into their faces and you can see, while they have smiles on them, their eyes are fearful and desperate, their bodies are emaciated and exhausted. They both look like their physical bodies are on the edge of collapse from nonstop dancing for god knows how long. You glance down at the ground around you, and you can see numerous piles of broken bones and discarded armor. All order of other creatures that have befallen this spot amongst the forest and never left. They're pulling against you. We're making opposed strength checks. Go ahead and roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck. I'm so weak, you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So are they right now, though. They're heavily emaciated.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just a regular strength check? It's not a saving throw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11. You feel as Scanlan, who was shoving off of you instinctually and both of these bodies grabbing his legs and pulling him down off the broom, he is pulled from your grasp, hits the ground, and the three of them continue their dance, completely nonchalant. Not even paying attention to your presence at this point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you're going to come and try to save him, plug your fucking ears, because I have a feeling this music is cursed. And I start shoving shit in my ears.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Keyleth, can you Druidcraft some cotton?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. You owe me six gold.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, we're going to save them. You owe me six gold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But she's running back out screaming! Three and three, we split the gold three-three. It was a draw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vex, could you go fetch a pail of water?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, hang on. How about this, you guys... I believe, as an elemental, I'm immune to charm effects.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, then fucking get in there and help him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You should do more than believe that. You should probably know that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe be an elemental and shove some shit in your ears.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I got into a rage, I can't be charmed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a campsite, correct? I'm going to start wandering until at least I have a sense of the size of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're right. I Druidcraft the cotton.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, cool. You guys all make your way back towards the direction of this little opening, this gap in this grove.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to let him out of the Pokéball before we get him out!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm doing that thing with the wolfman where I'm miming a lasso and pulling him closer to me to dance closer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, and they're into it. It is unlike a song you've ever heard, and everything else fades away: memory of your friends all drift out of your mind. All that matters is this moment, this dance, these people and the music. Any semblance of the personality of Scanlan that existed before is not there. All you feel is the muscles tensing and relaxing from the ever-present dance. The rest of you slowly begin to approach the outside of this opening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She just dumped me out. It's not my call.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you dumping him out or not?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm afraid because of the music's still playing. What if you're still charmed? I'm not going to dump him out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She keeps him in the necklace.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just the basic features of the area.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm in the necklace krumping right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would be ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell at this distance. There's a lot of the tree line at the edge of it that are blocking the shape.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vex, what did it look like?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did what look like?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The area where they are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a camp with bones all over the ground and floating music things. Dancing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Were there tents?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There weren't tents?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just dirt?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just bones.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was there a fire pit?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes? Was there a fire pit? There was a single fire pit. There was a floating violin and a floating set of drums.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Violin.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, I've got an idea. How about you race in, grab Scanlan, I'll kill the other two--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! Don't! They actually looked really distraught. I think they were under a spell, as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have you no mercy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we can save one, we can everybody, possibly. I haven't seen it yet. I'm going to try and get a little closer to it, gently.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to nock an arrow. And point it towards the violin and hold it there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Percy, you creep closer. As you get closer, the music gets louder.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you have stuff in your ears.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have packed my ears.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have, and as you approach, it doesn't seem to have an effect on the volume of the music.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm backing up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Make an intelligence check. Add your intelligence modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Please roll good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to notice the increasing volume despite the blockage in the ear pretty early on and stop your advancement before you get too close.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I sit. I pull out Bad News and I start to get a good look.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god, you're going to kill me?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm just going to cripple you. Calm down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like we should aim for the instruments.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The instruments are noncorporeal, I believe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're just elevated. You didn't get a good look at them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One way to find out. I'm going to take a shot at the violin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I haven't done this in so long. 17 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 to hit. That hits. Roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did you aim at?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The violin.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I aim at one of the other ones?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you want to fire at the same time?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, since he shot, I want to shoot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which one are you shooting at, the drums?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What else was there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There was the drums, the flute, and the violin.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Drums.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an attack for the drums.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The woods are full of Irishmen.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 12 points of damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit, Flogging Molly's playing the Feywild, yo!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 hits, so damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12. And roll damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, okay. Scanlan, I need you to roll a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Saving throw? Not at disadvantage? Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys with your natural 20s! Okay. Roll it again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Back-to-back?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What the what?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's absurd. You've been storing this shit after a week we've been gone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think that's happened since we played at home.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it happened when I was saving him against the Briarwoods. Two natural 20s.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's right!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was 35 episodes ago.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You take 24 points of psychic damage, Scanlan. As both of you guys fire, both of the instruments scatter for a second, and there is an echo of psychic energy that resonates throughout the entirety of that grove. The fire shakes and dissipates, almost going out. Scanlan, you can see reach up and grab the sides of his head in pain. The guard and the wolf that were dancing do the same, except they both collapse immediately on the ground. A moment passes, the instruments reform, the music continues, and Scanlan goes right back into the dance.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I throw my white man's overbite back on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe it's time for Grog to go in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. Round two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Round two, Grog runs in and grabs Scanlan, and we run out. He can't be charmed!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Before you let me off the chain. There are trees, right? Who's benefitting from this charm?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The instruments and the campsite.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's not somebody in a tree, hiding out?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think the campsite just might be a campsite. I want to try and douse the fire.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you want to rage and go in, I can be there on standby.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're going to let me go?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like we should let Grog go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I use Alter Self to shape my fist into a giant rock fist and I deck Grog to throw him into a rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The jaw is momentarily displaced as you pop it back into place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog, go get our bard!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, the music is all around you, but you don't hear it because all you see is red and Scanlan's fucking horrible white man's overbite dancing by himself at the campsite with no allies.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know if I've killed an elf in quite a while, so I'm going to aim my axe at the throat of the elf that's dancing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The elf isn't dancing; both he and the werewolf are on the ground, unmoving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They didn't get back up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, they're fucking down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's just me and some instruments now. You have to come get me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sweet, I'm just grabbing Scanlan and running straight through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you guys to make opposed athletics checks. No, this would be strength.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Strength or athletics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For this one, I initially said athletics; that's fine. They're almost equatable.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Saving or check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. You grab Scanlan. You begin to make your way out of the camp. It was 40 or 50 feet to get in and grab him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is he starting to make his way out of the camp?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's grabbed Scanlan and pulled Scanlan off his feet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to shoot him in the shoulder with my Retort gun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Roll an attack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keep the rage going? Nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ooh, just barely. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Total of 16? What's your armor class, Grog?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's better. 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your armor class?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank god. It's been so long! Where are all my dice? Just a nick. 16 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 16 points of piercing damage, halved, so you take eight. You feel the music begin to creep into your ears as the blood pumping in your skull begins to subside, and then (gunshot) your shoulder gets blown back. You look over and you can see the bullet wound and the blood beginning to pour out of the small piercing wound you've suffered in your shoulder. The red takes over once again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vax! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Clutching Scanlan at your side, you go running out of the field. Because this is the secondary round now, make one more athletics check versus his athletics check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Scanlan's pushing away as hard as he can against your body, but you have him footballed under your arm and go charging out of the center there. As you pull out of the center of the camp, the flame's reclaimed its general spiraling height. The music keeps playing, and then as you guys rejoin the rest of the party, the music begins to fade as the instruments slowly drift down and lay still.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good, it stopped. We can go back out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (cackles) Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're all right now. Your brain comes to you. Your legs are a little sore, and you were already exhausted to begin with.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I instinctually start freaking Grog. Dry hump dancing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like a little dog on my calf?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so you're all right, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There were lights.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I release my brother. He's out of Raven's Slumber.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did we see a play yet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was the worst play I've ever seen.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's more of an intermission.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Garmelie! Why didn't you warn us that could happen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Garmelie, who's there by the side, comes out of his invisibility, and says, "I tried! I really "tried! But you guys continually insist to go face-first in whatever I warn you about, because "you don't trust me, apparently, when you hired me to be your guide!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We trust you, dear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hopefully you've learned a lesson! God." (sighs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow. That was amazing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we loot the campfire?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should not go back out there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we get those weapons, somehow?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which weapons?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The musical weapons.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You want the magical enchanted instruments?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess we can't get them, can we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Best to avoid them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a trap. It's not actually musical instruments.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll flip a coin, right, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that's it. Roll a d20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Disadvantage. One.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's avoid it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what are you guys doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We move towards the dusk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're moving towards the Gilded Run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you guys begin moving away, Garmelie scoots up a little bit and gets a look in the edge, and goes, "Well, you certainly found the happy campsite, so good job."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, you told us about that earlier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes! Yes, I did."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's the happy campsite.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Have you not figured that out yet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought he was being metaphorical. I didn't know it was literal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sighs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is quite literally the land of literalism at this point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We make people sigh a lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. I need you to roll a survival check with advantage, leading the group forward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. All right. You guys continue pushing duskward. Between you and Garmelie leading the way, the forest gets ever thicker. The trees get even closer together, and you feel that some areas have no more than maybe three or four feet between the tree trunks themselves. The rest is really angry, tangled roots, as well as the high-growing underbrush of the entire forest. Moon still unmoving in the sky.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we trampling anything as we're walking?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we're not stepping on mandrakes, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. In fact, it's her high rolls that are keeping you guys from stepping into any of the local dangerous possibly screaming fauna.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, did my Countercharm help at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It gave us advantage--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But did you need it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I did, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, I did it right!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Half-elves have advantage on charm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It didn't help?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It didn't help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With anybody else, though, it would've helped. It actually helped you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I still was charmed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You still were charmed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is the footing here precarious? I know she's leading us through, but is it all viney and shitty?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not great. It would slow your pace if you didn't have her leading you through. It's still not the fastest pace in the world, but you're able to keep going at a decent rate.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I jog up to Garmelie and Vex real fast? You said that there were lycans at some point, and you said they move through the trees, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, from what I've heard."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would that be these trees?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Possibly."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. Have you seen a lycan?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I haven't."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great. We should be keeping an eye on the trees.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was trying to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are having this conversation, you glance up, right into two yellowish eyes that are piercing from just past the leaf line of the canopy above you. As soon as you look up and see them, they immediately disappear in the darkness, and you hear a low growl and some shifting in the leaves above you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think they're here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look in your vicinity at what appear to be about six different medium to larger sized man-like humanoid creatures that step out of the trees, revealing themselves, most of which contain a wolf-like appearance, elongated snout, darker gray and brown furs, large pointy ears and gleaming angry eyes, the lips curled back revealing white teeth. You see one large tiger-like man, which sends you immediately into a recoiling moment, though larger than the rakshasa that you've experienced, and not with the signature back hands. They are unclothed, and you see barreling behind you guys, heavy footfalls as you see what looks to be a giant, bipedal bear clutching a greataxe comes (smash) through one of the tree clearings and (roars). They're not attacking. They're not advancing. They've just surrounded you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's not good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, they're here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I give Scanlan a little boot in the butt forward a couple of steps.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we've tread into your territory, we will exit immediately, and we apologize for offending you or your gods.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For what purpose?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We seek passage through this marshland to what lies beyond it. We are searching for--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Shademirk bog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Shademirk bog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We hope to rid the land of a cancerous tree that has been a blight for a very long time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I know not of this tree."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a source of great evil that's been corrupting this plane and ours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are many evils that corrupt this plane, small tasty thing."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not tasty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's not. Many diseases.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Dozens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The audio on my iPad needs some help, apparently. Time to get new music. Oh, that's an expenditure I don't need.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A new iPad for no reason?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Something else? It's our computer?

lines.name: CREW
lines.text: We're going to switch out the one that we usually use.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is so exciting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Isn't it, though? Especially at that climactic moment, my audio goes down.

lines.name: CREW
lines.text: Sorry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should probably kill it. I feel bad for everybody listening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bringing us back in now. Sorry about that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe just make it come out of your iPad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's something. Sure, we'll go with that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Works for us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's how we did it at home, man!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is the best simulation of our old home game that I've had.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (howls)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's Trinket doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket's backed up with you guys, growling and facing off with the bear-like entity that's keeping eyes on Trinket but is still (growling) up into the air of the forest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Ukurat. Isn't that the big ghost bear?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, that was Oralan. Ukurat's the lycan leader.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You now see this giant, feral beast, humanoid in shape once it begins to stand, but larger than anything you've seen before, as the large wolf-man creature stands at full height, about 12, 13 feet tall, its shoulders wider than yours, Grog. A series of various jeweled necklaces adorn its throat, and you can see what appears to be a makeshift leather belt and armored leg piece that sit upon it. Rings glimmer around its fingers, and you can see a series of scars drawn across one side of its cheek that go down to its throat. It looks about at the rest of you, separated, glancing at each side. "So. You seek passage, yes?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, that's right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There is a toll to pay. A favor to the Fendir is granted. A favor in kind."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A favor to you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Fendir, is that what you said?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We are the Fendir."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we would be happy to help if we can. We are here to do good, anyway. We've already done some. We conquered the devastating campsite of Soradun the Happy, and we're up to doing more tasks like that, if it would help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The wolf creature that you expect, at this point, is the Lord Ukurat that you heard mentioned before by both Garmelie and the wolf and beast kin, leans down towards you, making you uncomfortable, as his head is larger than your entire body, Scanlan. The lips curl back, and you can see the glistening white teeth, and drool slowly dripping off the edge of its curled purple-black lips. (sniffs) "We will not eat this day if you agree to do us this favor."
